cab.content: Printed for the War Cabinet. October 1944.21SECRET.Copy NoW.P. (44) 558.Uh October, 1944.WAR CABINET.SUEZ CANAL COMMITTEE.Note by the Secretary of the War Cabinet.AT their meeting on Monday, the 25th September, 1944 (W.M. (44)127th Conclusions, Minute 9), the War Cabinet set up a Ministerial Committeeto formulate the policies of His Majesty's Government in regard to the futureof the Suez Canal.The composition of the Committee has now been settled by the PrimeMinister as follows : Chairman Lord President of the Council.Members Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs.Secretary of State for the Colonies.First Lord of the Admiralty.Minister of War Transport.Minister of State.Financial Secretary to the Treasury.The Secretaries of the Committee will be Sir Gilbert Laithwaite and major-General Jacob, War Cabinet Offices.(Signed)E. E. BRIDGESOffices of the War Cabinet, S.W. 1,4th October, 1944.[28344J
